    • Class simulation.montecarlo.singleSpin extends Object implements Serializable

      serialVersionUID:
      625318162648175439L

      • Serialized Fields

        • localBx
          double localBx
          local applied magnetic field in the x direction (transverse)
        • localBy
          double localBy
          local applied magnetic field in the y direction (transverse)
        • localBz
          double localBz
          local applied magnetic field in the z direction (longitudinal) which is defined as the easy axis
        • n
          int n
          the spin's ordinal number within its lattice.
          See Also:
          Lattice.generateIsingLattice(int, int, double, boolean[])
        • prevBIndices
          int[][] prevBIndices
          first array contains the last indices of the local field (x,y,z) == (2,1,0) in the FieldTable second array is used to track whether consecutive calls (to find magneticMoment or energy) are correlated (separately for x,y,z) with 1 indicating correlation and 0 indicating otherwise.
        • s
          int s
          spin orientation: up=+1 and down=-1
        • spinSize
          double spinSize
          the magnetic moment of the ion (can change depending on the applied field)

          number of accepted parallel tempering swaps within the current bin

          double[] binAvg
          accumulated samples of all observables in the current bin (at even indices) and their squares (at odd indices)

          long currentBinCount
          current number of samples in current bin
        • currentEnergy
          double currentEnergy
          current energy of the system

          boolean lastSwapAccepted
          whether the last PT swap was accepted

          Lattice lattice
          the Lattice object being simulated
        • methodsUsed
          int[] methodsUsed
          array that counts how many times each method for solving the self-consistent calculation was successfully used

          the typical magnetic moment of the spins

          current number of sweeps (index)
        • T

          temperature
        • temperatureIndex

          index of this simulation within a MultipleTMonteCarloSimulation
        • tol
